title: NoWAL: Developments in staff development and training and procurement of e-books
abstract: This is an electronic version of an article published in the New Review of Academic Librarianship© 2004 Copyright Routledge, part of the Taylor & Francis Group; New Review of Academic Librarianship is available online at http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/13614533.asp
rawRecordXml:
<record><header><identifier>
oai:www.e-space.mmu.ac.uk:2173/3101</identifier><datestamp>2007-01-15T11:17:01Z</datestamp><setSpec>hdl_2173_736</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd" ><dc:title>NoWAL: Developments in staff development and training and procurement of e-books</dc:title><dc:creator>Harris, Colin</dc:creator><dc:subject>Academic libraries</dc:subject><dc:subject>NoWAL</dc:subject><dc:subject>Staff training and development</dc:subject><dc:subject>Librarianship</dc:subject><dc:subject>Professional education</dc:subject><dc:subject>Cooperation</dc:subject><dc:subject>Acquisitions</dc:subject><dc:subject>Electronic books</dc:subject><dc:subject>UK</dc:subject><dc:description>Introduces NoWAL (Northwest Academic Libraries), a consortium in the north west of England. Describes NoWAL's staff training and development programme which includes a general programme, the CILIP Certificate in Library and Information Practice, the CALIM Standard Professional Training programme and a pilot project for senior management. Additionally, NoWAL members engage in exchanging experience, job shadowing and visits. Also recounts how NoWAL secured a contract with OCLC's netlibrary that has led to the acquisition of a collection of up to 12,000 priced and 3,800 free titles - the biggest e-book deal in Europe.</dc:description><dc:description>This is an electronic version of an article published in the New Review of Academic Librarianship© 2004 Copyright Routledge, part of the Taylor & Francis Group; New Review of Academic Librarianship is available online at http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/13614533.asp</dc:description><dc:publisher>Routledge</dc:publisher><dc:date>2006-06-14T10:40:02Z</dc:date><dc:type>Article</dc:type><dc:format>YES</dc:format><dc:identifier>New review of academic librarianship, 2004, vol. 10, no. 2, pp. 119-127</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>1361-4533</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>10.1080/13614530500143711</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>http://hdl.handle.net/2173/3101</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>1740-7834</dc:identifier><dc:language>en</dc:language><dc:relation>http://www.metapress.com/media/mfta2gtytr5yxa768x2m/contributions/v/5/5/1/v5514l1148427297.pdf</dc:relation><dc:relation>http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/13614533.asp</dc:relation></oai_dc:dc></metadata></record>
